answers.content_html: No, it is not a natural science because it is not used in the study of the natural world.
answers.feedback_html: Mathematics is used in the study of the natural world, but that does not explain whether it is a natural science.

answers.content_html: No, it is not a natural science. Mathematics focuses on understanding mathematical relations and calculations, which is useful in natural sciences but which is distinct.
answers.feedback_html: Mathematics is not a natural science as it does not use chemical and physical measurements like other fields in natural sciences.

answers.content_html: Yes, it is a natural science. Mathematics deals with verifying the experimental data.
answers.feedback_html: Mathematics does not use the chemical and physical measurements, therefore it is not natural science.

answers.content_html: Yes, it is a natural science. It uses chemical and physical measurements.
answers.feedback_html: Mathematics does not use chemical and physical measurements.

stem_html: Is mathematics a natural science? Explain your reasoning.

answers.feedback_html: A community consists of all organisms of all different species in a particular geographic area.
An ecosystem includes all the abiotic and biotic components, not just species belonging to a particular group.
A family is a taxonomic rank.
A population consists of all of the individuals of a single species in a particular geographic area.

stem_html: What is a group of individuals of the same species living in the same area called?

answers.content_html: Line B is a decreasing line while line A is an increasing line, with line B being much steeper than line A.
answers.feedback_html: What does the sign of the slope mean? The magnitude of the slope determines the steepness of line.

answers.content_html: NADPH and ATP molecules are produced during the light reactions and are used to power the light independent reactions.
answers.feedback_html: NADPH and ATP molecules are the end products of the light reactions. The free energy stored in ATP and NADPH is used to power the light independent reactions. PSII captures energy to create proton gradients to make ATP. While, PSI captures energy to reduce \text{NADP}^+ to NADPH.

answers.content_html: NADPH and ATP molecules are produced during the light reactions, which are used to power the light dependent reactions.
answers.feedback_html: NADPH and ATP power the light independent reactions.

answers.content_html: Sugar and ATP are produced during the light reactions, which are used to power the light independent reactions.
answers.feedback_html: Sugar is the end product of the light independent reactions.

answers.content_html: Carbon dioxide and NADPH are produced during the light reactions, which are used to power the light dependent reactions.

answers.feedback_html: Glucose is synthesized from the photosynthesis process, using solar energy. It is also used in cellular respiration.
Plants are autotrophs which synthesize their own food, using solar energy. They are consumed by only heterotrophs.
Metabolic pathways include catabolism and anabolism, which either utilize energy or produce energy.
The main source of energy for this planet is the Sun. Solar energy includes light, radio waves and X-rays, all of which provide energy on Earth.

answers.feedback_html: You may have wrongly assumed 1\,\text{km} is 100\,\text{m}. The prefix kilo indicates 1000. Use 1000\,\text{m} = 1\,\text{m} and convert.
342\,\text{m/s} is equivalent to 1.23 \times 10^3\,\text{km/h}.
To convert speed from \text{m/s} to \text{km/h}, just multiply the speed given in \text{m/s} by 3.6.
The conversion factor for converting seconds to hours should be used carefully. Recall that 60 seconds make 1 minute and 60 minutes make 1 hour.

stem_html: The speed of sound is measured at 342\,\text{m/s} on a certain day. What is this in \text{km/h}? Report your answer in scientific notation.

answers.feedback_html: There is an uncertainty of 5 beats per minute in the pulse rate. Find the percent uncertainty by multiplying the ratio of uncertainty in the measurement by 100.
5 out of 130 is the uncertainty fraction, convert this into a percentage.
An uncertainty of 5 out of 130 is equivalent to around 4\% of 130.
Multiply the fraction \frac{5}{130} with 100 and then round off to the nearest integer.
